docs.lead_paragraph: Never in his wildest dreams did Joe Benincasa, president of The Actors Fund, think he'd ever get a Tony Award. That, he thought, was reserved for those onstage rather than those wanting to affect public policy and politics.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Veterans Affairs Secretary Eric Shinseki resigned on Friday after a political firestorm over widespread delays in veterans' medical care, leaving President Barack Obama with a freer hand to address systemic problems bedeviling the agency.

headline.main: Obama Accepts Veterans Affairs Chief Resignation With 'Regret'
headline.print_headline: Obama Accepts Veterans Affairs Chief Resignation With 'Regret'

docs.snippet: U.S. Veterans Affairs Secretary Eric Shinseki resigned on Friday after a political firestorm over widespread delays in veterans' medical care, leaving President Barack Obama with a freer hand to address systemic problems bedeviling the agency.

docs.lead_paragraph: Beset by growing evidence of patient delays and cover-ups, embattled Veterans Affairs Secretary Eric Shinseki resigned from President Barack Obama's Cabinet Friday, taking the blame for what he decried as a "lack of integrity" in the sprawling health care system for the nation's military veterans.

docs.lead_paragraph: Fears that a looming U.S. fine on BNP Paribas BNPP.PA could be big enough to force it to raise capital and restrict its dividends hit France's biggest bank on Friday, driving its shares sharply lower.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. John Kitzhaber asked the state attorney general to sue the company that built the state’s online health insurance enrollment system, the failure of which resulted in multiple investigations.

headline.main: Oregon: Suit Sought Over Health Site
headline.print_headline: Oregon: Suit Sought Over Health Site

docs.abstract: Oregon Gov John Kitzhaber asks state attorney general to sue Oracle, company that built the state’s online health insurance enrollment system, failure of which resulted in multiple investigations.

docs.lead_paragraph: With too few doctors to handle a swelling patient population of veterans, hospital officials were under pressure to excel in the annual performance reviews used to determine raises, an inspector general’s report found.

headline.main: Doctor Shortage Is Cited in Delays at V.A. Hospitals
headline.print_headline: Doctor Shortage Is Cited in Delays at V.A. Hospitals

docs.abstract: Veterans Affairs Department's inspector general releases report finding that at heart of falsified data at Phoenix medical center, and possibly many other veterans hospitals, is acute shortage of doctors, particularly primary care ones, to handle swelling patient population of veterans; also cites pressures on hospital administrators to excel in annual performance reviews used to determine raises, bonuses, promotions and other benefits.
docs.snippet: With too few doctors to handle a swelling patient population of veterans, hospital officials were under pressure to excel in the annual performance reviews used to determine raises, an inspector general’s report found.

docs.lead_paragraph: The House and Senate are confronting the broadening health scandal at the department in ways that will challenge both parties to rethink the future of the medical system for veterans.

headline.main: Boehner and Pelosi Resist Cries for Ouster of Veterans Affairs Chief
headline.print_headline: Boehner and Pelosi Resist Cries for Ouster of Veterans Affairs Chief

docs.abstract: Republican House Speaker John A Boehner and minority leader Rep Nancy Pelosi both say replacing Secretary of Veterans Affairs Eric Shinseki will not solve core issue of unacceptable wait times and secret waiting lists at Veteran Affairs health centers around country; broadening scandal will challenge parties to rethink future of veterans medical system.
docs.snippet: The House and Senate are confronting the broadening health scandal at the department in ways that will challenge both parties to rethink the future of the medical system for veterans.
